section.p: Arbitrator services monitor user network connectivity and are optional. They test external IP addresses that approximate user locations in order to test user reachability. Arbitrator services are associated with a host that runs User-Facing Services (UFS). Each host should have an operational Arbitrator. They are registered with the host (e.g., CLC, WS, or CC), not the services. All services on the registered host can use the Arbitrator services. Arbitrator services can test through each NIC where users might access Euca cloud services. CC can have up to 3 Arbitrators configured. CLC and WS can have an unlimited number of Arbitrators.
